Thanks for confirming your license! 👍

If you’re looking to change the priority of a fault (for example, a support ticket or issue you’ve reported), I’ll need a bit more context to help you out:

  • Are you referring to changing the priority of a support ticket you’ve already opened with us?
  • Or do you want to adjust the priority of anti-spam filters within GFI MailEssentials itself?


If you’re talking about anti-spam filter priority, you can customize the order in which filters are applied. Here’s how you can do it:

  1. Go to the GFI MailEssentials Portal.
  2. Navigate to Anti-Spam > Filter Priority.
  3. Use the up (▲) or down (▼) arrows to assign higher or lower priority to each filter, as described in this article: How to configure Anti-Spam filter priority?.


If you meant something else, could you clarify what you mean by “fault priority”? That way, I can give you the most accurate instructions!

--- AI Assistant ---

Thanks for sharing those details! I understand that after installing GFI MailEssentials version 22.2, EML files are piling up in the Replay folder. That definitely sounds frustrating, and I want to help you get to the bottom of it.

This kind of issue is often related to mail flow problems after an upgrade, where emails aren't being processed as expected. Here are some steps and resources that can help:

  1. Sometimes, after an upgrade, certain files or services may not be working correctly, causing emails to get stuck in the Replay folder. Reinstalling MailEssentials with the latest installer can resolve this. You can find detailed steps in this article: MailEssentials is not scanning emails.


  1. If you notice that the Dashboard logs aren't updating and queues are building up, you might need to purge the Anti-Spam and Anti-Virus Scan Engine queues. This process is safe and won't result in lost emails. Instructions are available here: Purging the Anti-Spam and Anti-Virus Scan Engine Message Queues.


Before we proceed, could you let me know:
  • Are you seeing any errors in the MailEssentials dashboard or Windows Event Viewer?
  • Is mail flow otherwise normal, or are emails delayed/not delivered?
  • Did you perform an in-place upgrade, or was this a fresh install?


Once I have this info, I can guide you through the most relevant troubleshooting steps!
